definition: to wear down/to sap/to whittle away/to while away/to idle away
to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need
to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist

sentences.english: He killed off the whole morning by listening to the music.
sentences.chinese: 他通過聽音樂消磨掉了整個上午的時光。

sentences.english: But am I going to devote all my spare time to it?
sentences.chinese: 但我會把全部的空閒時間都消磨在拼字上嗎？

sentences.english: I spent the afternoon pottering about in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 我在花園裏閒逛消磨下午。

sentences.english: You cannot kill time without injuring eternity.
sentences.chinese: 消磨時分沒有成能舶冢險永遠。

sentences.english: We went to a cafe and lazed the whole afternoon away there.
sentences.chinese: 我們去了一間咖啡館，在那兒消磨了整個下午。

sentences.english: The men spend their leisure time drinking the local brew.
sentences.chinese: 男人們喝着當地釀的酒消磨時間。

sentences.english: There is nothing more demoralizing than a small but adequate income. - E. Wilson.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼比一份不多不少的收入更消磨人的鬥志了。

sentences.english: He whiled away the hours of waiting by reading a book.
sentences.chinese: 他等待時以看書來消磨時間。

sentences.english: I am just for killing the time.
His  spirit was vitiated by pleasure seeking.
sentences.chinese: 他的志氣因追求喫喝玩樂而消磨殆盡。

sentences.english: And they all hung out at the Big Wheel truck stop.
sentences.chinese: 而他們都在“大轉盤”卡車休息站消磨時光。

sentences.english: That thou consum'st thy self in single life?
sentences.chinese: 你在獨身生活裏消磨你自己？

sentences.english: He has dribbled away his time and energy.
sentences.chinese: 他逐漸消磨掉了他的時間和精力。

sentences.english: Being outside is one of the best time wasters .
sentences.chinese: 外出是消磨時間的最好方法。

sentences.english: He spent his time tippling at the inn.
sentences.chinese: 他在酒店飲酒消磨時光。

sentences.english: We should not idle away our valuable time in the claver.
sentences.chinese: 我們不應該把寶貴的時間消磨在閒談之中。

definition: to exhaust/to use up/to deplete/to drain
wear and tear/to wear away over time
to waste/to spend/to consume/to squander/news/(coll.) to delay/to dilly-dally
to save bit by bit/to accumulate
